intro: Buglossoides splitgerberi, commonly known as the Desert Blueweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is well adapted to dry, hot environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, with a fuzzy texture that helps reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in shades of blue to purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
